text: <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene activation in T cells is known to involve the transcription factors nuclear factor-kappa B , AP-1 , NFAT , and <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Here we demonstrate that the human <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and enhancer also encompass binding sites for core - binding factor ( CBF ) .

text: Significantly , the CBF sites are in each case contained within the minimum essential core regions required for inducible activation of transcription .
Furthermore , these core regions of the enhancer and promoter each encompass closely linked binding sites for CBF , AP-1 , and <extra_id_0> NFATp <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter CBF site TGTGGTCA is located 51 bp upstream of the transcription start site and also overlaps a <extra_id_0> YY-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site .
A 2-bp mutation within the CBF site resulted in a 2-3-fold decrease in the activities of both a 69-bp proximal promoter fragment and a 627-bp full-length promoter fragment .

Stepwise deletions into the proximal promoter also revealed that the CBF site , but not the <extra_id_0> YY-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site , was required for efficient induction of transcriptional activation .

The <extra_id_0> AML1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CBF beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes that encode CBF each have the ability to influence cell growth and differentiation and have been implicated as proto-oncogenes in acute myeloid leukemia .

This study adds <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to a growing list of cytokines and receptors that are regulated by CBF and which control the growth , differentiation , and activation of hemopoietic cells .
The <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus may represent one of several target genes that are dysregulated in acute myeloid leukemia .
